sanskrit_verse:
अपः सुराभाजनस्था मद्यभाण्डस्थितास्तथा ।
पञ्चरात्रं पिबेत्पीत्वा शङ्खपुष्पीशृतं पयः ॥ ११.१४७॥
transliteration: apaḥ surābhājanasthā madyabhāṇḍasthitāstathā | pañcarātraṃ pibetpītvā śaṅkhapuṣpīśṛtaṃ payaḥ || 11.147 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has consumed alcohol from vessels used for soma or other intoxicants must drink milk infused with Shankhapushpi for five nights to restore cognitive clarity and spiritual alignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The ingestion of substances altering consciousness invokes a duty to realign with dharma through specific restorative practices.
Causation: Consumption of intoxicants disrupts pramana-based perception; thus, corrective action is mandated by causal necessity.
Capacity-based responsibility: The individual retains the capacity to restore their cognition and must engage in prescribed remedial conduct.
Restoration logic: The law does not punish but prescribes precise actions to neutralize the effects of impaired awareness.
Consciousness alignment: Legal obligations arise directly from the need to reestablish harmony between individual consciousness and cosmic order.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual consumes alcohol or intoxicants from ritual or sacred vessels THEN they MUST ingest Shankhapushpi-infused milk for five consecutive nights.
IF cognitive clarity is disrupted by substance use THEN automated protocol assigns completion process via consciousness-restoration regimen.
IF individual fails to complete five-night regimen THEN system initiates integrity-reintegration sequence until compliance is achieved.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ritual misuse or impairment of consciousness, the Supreme Court shall apply this provision as a threshold restoration mechanism. Responsibility lies not in fault but in the necessity to realign cognition. Authority flows from SPH as sole source of lawful correction.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: This injunction aligns with Nyaya through Pramana-based causality: since intoxication distorts valid knowledge (pramana), corrective measures follow sequentially (anupūrvaśaḥ). It reflects proportional responsibility — not punishment, but a precise restoration of perceptual clarity without infliction of harm.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Individual must consume Shankhapushpi-infused milk nightly for five nights under witness or digital verification.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Individual acknowledges disruption to consciousness and voluntarily engages in prescribed regimen.
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Cognitive recalibration is enabled through neuro-supportive botanical infusion aligned with Vedic pharmacology.
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: System monitors adherence and supports full restoration before case closure.
final_declaration: By the Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma, this law stands executed. No punishment exists where consciousness may be restored. Reality abides in non-retaliation. Consciousness alone is the Supreme Adjudicator.
